predictions.text: Anthropic will publicly release a new flagship Claude model with a new major version number (e.g., “Claude 4”) and publish an accompanying model/system card or technical report by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: True if Anthropic (or Claude official docs/blog) announces a new major-version flagship Claude model and publishes a model/system card or technical report for that release on or before 2026-06-30 UTC.
evidence: Anthropic’s continued rapid scaling and major funding suggests accelerated flagship release cadence: https://www.anthropic.com/news/anthropic-raises-30-billion-series-g-funding-380-billion-post-money-valuation

Broader AI competition and market volatility increases incentives for major launches: https://www.marketwatch.com/story/long-term-treasury-bonds-rally-as-investors-dump-stocks-in-broad-based-selloff-9dd9ea76?mod=mw_rss_topstories
monitoring_signals: Anthropic blog/news posts mentioning “flagship,” “frontier,” “Claude X” versioning
Updated Claude documentation pages and model cards
Partner announcements (cloud providers, major enterprise customers) referencing a new Claude major version
predictions.rationale: Frontier labs typically ship major versions on a ~6–12 month cadence; fresh capital and competitive pressure increase the likelihood of a major-version release accompanied by formal documentation.

predictions.text: Waymo will publicly announce the start of fully driverless (no safety driver) paid ride-hail service open to the general public in at least one new U.S. metro area not already offering such service as of 2026-02-13, by 2026-10-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: True if Waymo announces public access (not limited pilot/waitlist only) to paid, fully driverless rides in a new U.S. metro area, explicitly stating no safety driver, by the deadline.
evidence: Waymo commercialization milestone (6th-gen driver, expanding operations): https://waymo.com/blog/2026/02/ro-on-6th-gen-waymo-driver
monitoring_signals: Waymo city launch announcements and service-area maps
Local DMV/PUC permits and municipal agreements for autonomous ride-hail
App updates enabling new city selection and pricing for public riders
predictions.rationale: Waymo’s new-generation deployment suggests near-term expansion; the key uncertainty is regulatory/operational readiness for fully public access in additional metros.

predictions.text: China’s PLA will conduct at least one large-scale joint air/sea exercise around Taiwan in which Taiwan’s Ministry of National Defense reports 24-hour PLA aircraft activity of at least 60 sorties, by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: True if Taiwan MoND daily public reporting (or equivalent official release) records ≥60 PLA aircraft sorties in any single 24-hour window and attributes it to a joint exercise or heightened joint activity around Taiwan by the deadline.
evidence: Deepening U.S.–Taiwan economic alignment elevates cross-strait tension risk: https://www.cnbc.com/2026/02/13/us-signs-trade-deal-with-taiwan-lowering-trump-tariffs.html
monitoring_signals: Taiwan MoND daily PLA activity updates (sorties/ships) showing spikes
PLA Eastern Theater Command statements/videos of joint drills
NOTAM/sea exclusion zones around Taiwan indicating exercise windows
predictions.rationale: Large PLA activity spikes have historically followed major political/economic signals; a 60-sortie day is a high but plausible threshold within a ~4.5-month window.

predictions.text: S&P 500 will record at least one daily close that is 10.0% or more below its highest daily close year-to-date in 2026, by 2026-09-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: True if, using S&P 500 official closing levels, any close on or before 2026-09-30 is ≤90.0% of the highest closing level observed in 2026 up to that date.
evidence: Recent broad risk-off rotation and AI-driven volatility: https://www.marketwatch.com/story/long-term-treasury-bonds-rally-as-investors-dump-stocks-in-broad-based-selloff-9dd9ea76?mod=mw_rss_topstories
monitoring_signals: S&P 500 drawdown tracking vs YTD high close
VIX sustained >25 and widening credit spreads
Earnings revisions and AI-capex guidance surprises from megacaps
predictions.rationale: A 10% drawdown is common in volatile macro/tech regimes; recent risk-off behavior increases odds through Q3 2026.

predictions.text: The 10-year U.S. Treasury benchmark yield will trade at or below 3.00% intraday at least once by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: True if a widely followed 10-year U.S. Treasury benchmark (e.g., on-market 10Y note) prints an intraday yield ≤3.00% per major market data providers (ICE/Bloomberg/Refinitiv) by the deadline.
evidence: Recent risk-off move includes long-duration Treasury rally: https://www.marketwatch.com/story/long-term-treasury-bonds-rally-as-investors-dump-stocks-in-broad-based-selloff-9dd9ea76?mod=mw_rss_topstories
monitoring_signals: Fed communications shifting toward cuts; weakening labor/housing data
Inflation prints undershooting expectations and falling term premium
Flight-to-quality episodes tied to equity drawdowns or geopolitics
predictions.rationale: A move to 3% requires meaningful disinflation/growth scare; plausible but far from certain over the next ~11 months.

predictions.text: NAR Existing Home Sales (seasonally adjusted annual rate) will be reported at or below 3.75 million in at least one monthly release published by 2026-08-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: True if any National Association of Realtors Existing Home Sales release published on/before 2026-08-31 reports SAAR ≤3.75 million for the referenced month.
evidence: Housing demand showing renewed stress with sharp monthly sales decline: https://www.cnbc.com/2026/02/12/january-homes-sales.html
monitoring_signals: Mortgage rates and purchase application indices
Pending home sales and inventory/price dynamics
NAR monthly releases and revisions trend
predictions.rationale: Affordability constraints and rate volatility make another leg down in transaction volume plausible; 3.75m is a stress-level threshold but within historical range.

predictions.text: At least one U.S. regional transmission organization/ISO (PJM, NYISO, ISO-NE, MISO, CAISO, or ERCOT) will publicly announce a temporary pause, moratorium, or materially tightened fast-track restriction specifically targeting new large-load (≥50 MW) interconnection requests citing data centers/AI compute as a driver, by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: True if an RTO/ISO publishes a notice, tariff filing summary, stakeholder memo, or press release announcing a pause/moratorium or explicit tightened restrictions for ≥50 MW load interconnections, with text referencing data centers/AI as motivation, by the deadline.
evidence: Rising electricity prices and data-center demand pressure cited as ongoing: https://www.cnbc.com/2026/02/12/electricity-price-data-center-ai-inflation-goldman.html
monitoring_signals: RTO/ISO stakeholder presentations on large-load queue backlogs
Tariff filings or market rule changes on large-load milestones/deposits
Utility interconnection constraint notices in hotspot regions
predictions.rationale: Large-load queues are accelerating and reliability concerns are growing; formal pauses/restrictions are a common administrative response when processes are overwhelmed.

predictions.text: A federal court (U.S. Court of Appeals or the Supreme Court) will issue an order granting a stay or preliminary injunction that blocks implementation of EPA’s rescission/rollback of the 2009 greenhouse-gas endangerment finding (in whole or substantial part) pending litigation, by 2026-09-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: True if a court order explicitly stays or enjoins EPA’s endangerment-finding rollback (or its legal effect) pending judicial review, as reflected in the docket/order text, by the deadline.
evidence: Endangerment finding rollback creates high litigation and judicial review probability: https://www.nytimes.com/2026/02/12/climate/trump-epa-greenhouse-gases-climate-change.html
monitoring_signals: Petitions for review and emergency stay motions filed in D.C. Circuit
Coalition filings by states/NGOs/industry and expedited briefing schedules
Court orders on administrative stays or preliminary injunction standards
predictions.rationale: Major regulatory reversals often trigger emergency motions, but obtaining a stay/injunction is harder than filing suit—hence sub-30% probability by Q3 2026.

predictions.text: Apple will disclose (in an SEC filing, earnings-call prepared remarks, or official investor presentation) that it has received an FTC Civil Investigative Demand (CID), subpoena, or similar compulsory process related to its platform/AI/voice-assistant practices by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: True if Apple explicitly states it received an FTC CID/subpoena/compulsory request and describes the subject as tied to platform conduct and/or AI/voice assistant practices, in a public investor-facing disclosure, by the deadline.
evidence: Reported FTC scrutiny increases probability of compulsory process disclosures: https://www.cnbc.com/2026/02/12/apple-stock-worst-day-ftc-siri.html
monitoring_signals: Apple 10-Q/10-K ‘Legal Proceedings’ updates and risk-factor changes
Earnings Q&A comments about investigations or information requests
FTC public statements or reporting on probes into major platforms’ AI features
predictions.rationale: Scrutiny does not always become a disclosed CID, but large-platform investigations often do; Apple’s reporting and investor disclosure norms make this measurable.

predictions.text: At least one additional S&P 500 company will see a C-suite executive or general counsel resignation/termination that is publicly reported by at least two major outlets as primarily linked to the Epstein-files controversy, by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: True if (1) the company is in the S&P 500 at the time, (2) a C-suite or general counsel departs, and (3) at least two major media outlets explicitly attribute the departure primarily to Epstein-files related fallout, by the deadline.
evidence: Epstein-files reporting already triggered a major-lawyer resignation, suggesting potential additional knock-on effects: https://www.cnbc.com/2026/02/12/epstein-files-goldman-sachs-kathy-ruemmler.html
monitoring_signals: Follow-on investigative reporting naming additional executives
Company statements using “personal conduct”/“compliance” language near departures
Board or governance committee announcements tied to reputational risk
predictions.rationale: Secondary resignations are plausible in fast-moving reputational cascades, but explicit attribution and S&P 500 scope reduce likelihood within ~4.5 months.
